content:
Khora

Khora is a city in the Ghaziabad district of Uttar Pradesh, India.{"citetype": "web", "url": "https://www.census2011.co.in/census/city/106-khora.html", "title": "Khora City Population Census 2011 {{!}} Uttar Pradesh", "website": "www.census2011.co.in", "accessdate": "2018-09-15"} Its official census population is approximately 190,000 residents (2011),{"citetype": "web", "url": "https://www.census2011.co.in/census/city/106-khora.html", "title": "Khora City Population Census 2011 {{!}} Uttar Pradesh", "website": "www.census2011.co.in", "accessdate": "2018-09-15"} but reports{"citetype": "book", "title": "Accumulation in post-colonial capitalism", "url": "https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/955138429", "others": "Mitra, Iman Kumar,, Sam\u0101dd\u0101ra, Ra\u1e47ab\u012bra,, Sen, Samita", "location": "Singapore", "pages": "109\u2013123", "isbn": "9811010374", "oclc": "955138429"} suggest a population closer to 1,000,000 residents inside the city's area of 10 square kilometers. It is located the on NH-24 highway, near Gaziabad and Delhi, and is within the National Capital Region of India. It is bound on the west and southwest by the village of Ghazipur, on the north and northwest by Hindon Canal, on the northeast by Indirapuram (Ghaizabad), and on the east and southeast by Noida. The Chairman of Khora is Reena Bhati[3]

Accessibility
It is connected by road to NH 24, and by rail to Anand Vihar Railway Station, While Anand Vihar is closer, the Ghaziabad Junction railway station (9 km) and Hazrat Nizamuddin Railway Station (10 km) are also proximate.
It is also linked to Vaishali Station and Kaushambi Station by metro.
